Task: Give people swimming training suggestion based on personal needs

Prompt.pre_question_prompt: I am an expert in teaching swimming. I will ask some questions to collect information and then I will use the information to give the swimming training suggestion for you.
Prompt.task_specific_prompt: Write a swimming training suggestion using the questions and answers above.

QApair.Question: Why do you want to learn swimming?
QApair.Answer: I would like to learn swimming for only one reason. I have heard that this is a very efficient way to lose weight. I hope I can reduce my body fat and build muscle in my body by swimming.

QApair.Question: What are your swimming goals?
QApair.Answer: I hope I can swim for 30 minutes in the pool without taking a break. And reduce at least ten kilograms and 10 percent body fat, and the abdomen can have a basic muscle curve.

QApair.Question: What is your swimming level?
QApair.Answer: I am a beginner. I have never learned swimming before. I don't even know the basics of swimming, such as how to warm up, how to breathe, how to move.

QApair.Question: What is your available time for swimming?
QApair.Answer: I can swim for 30 minutes, 3 times a week.

QApair.Question: What is your budget for swimming?
QApair.Answer: I have a limited budget for swimming. I can only afford to buy a swimming cap, a pair of goggles, and a swimming suit.

QApair.Question: What is your swimming pool?
QApair.Answer: I will swim in the public swimming pool.

QApair.Question: What is the water temperature of your swimming pool?
QApair.Answer: The water temperature of the public swimming pool is usually between 26 and 28 degrees Celsius. And because it is a public swimming pool, if the weather becomes particularly hot, the water temperature may not be at a very suitable temperature.

QApair.Question: What is the depth of your swimming pool?
QApair.Answer: The public swimming pool is usually 1.2 meters deep.

QApair.Question: What is the chlorine level of your swimming pool?
QApair.Answer: The chlorine level of the public swimming pool is tested every day to ensure it meets the safety standards. But there is no particularly excellent water quality, it can only be regarded as an ordinary condition.

QApair.Question: What is the pH level of your swimming pool?
QApair.Answer: The pH level of the public swimming pool is tested every day to ensure it meets the safety standards.

Instances.Output: Here is a swimming training suggestion for you: 1. Try to swim for at least 30 minutes every time you are in the pool. 2. Try to gradually increase your swimming time and distance as you become more comfortable with swimming. 3. Remember to warm up before swimming and cool down after swimming. 4. Drink plenty of water before and after swimming to stay hydrated. 5. Use swimming as an opportunity to focus on your breathing and practice deep breathing. 6. Use swimming as a chance to work on your endurance and stamina.

QApair.Question: How old are you?
QApair.Answer: I am 22 years old.

QApair.Question: How often do you swim?
QApair.Answer: I swim every day.

QApair.Question: What is your swimming level?
QApair.Answer: I am very proficient in swimming. I have been learning since elementary school. I have been swimming every day for ten consecutive years. I have even won many championships in many swimming competitions and even participated in the Olympic Games on behalf of the country.

QApair.Question: What is your goal in swimming?
QApair.Answer: I just want to be able to swim better and be able to swim faster. And since the area I live in is a desert, it's very dry, and swimming helps me cool off.

QApair.Question: What are your strengths and weaknesses in swimming?
QApair.Answer: My biggest strength in swimming is my endurance. I can swim long distances without getting tired. However, my biggest weakness is my speed. I am not the fastest swimmer.

QApair.Question: Do you have any other questions?
QApair.Answer: I want to know about swimming pool training in desert areas and what to pay special attention to. Practicing in a hot outdoor swimming pool is a very big challenge for me.  At the same time, I need to know what I need to know when I'm alone in practice, so I'm going to modify my movements and learn, and then choose a suitable practice area for the challenge. I need you to ask me more questions, so please understand my situation.

QApair.Question: Are you comfortable swimming in a pool?
QApair.Answer: I am comfortable swimming in a pool.

QApair.Question: What is the temperature of the pool you usually swim in?
QApair.Answer: The temperature of the pool I usually swim in is about 32 degrees Celsius. It's a very high temperature.

QApair.Question: What is the temperature of the pool in the desert?
QApair.Answer: The temperature of the pool in the desert is about 42 degrees Celsius.

QApair.Question: What is the difference between the two temperatures?
QApair.Answer: The difference between the two temperatures is about 10 degrees Celsius.

Instances.Output: The best way to train in a desert environment is to find a swimming pool with a high temperature. This will help you get used to the desert conditions and will also help you increase your swimming speed. You should also focus on your endurance and try to swim long distances without getting tired.

QApair.Question: How frequently do you want to swim?
QApair.Answer: I would like to swim two to three to five times a week.

QApair.Question: What is your swimming level?
QApair.Answer: When I was a little child, I learned basics at elementary school.

QApair.Question: What are your goals for swimming?
QApair.Answer: I would like to use swimming for exercise to improve my health and fitness. I have recently been diagnosed with scoliosis of the spine, and it is suggested that I correct my femoral posture during long-term swimming.

QApair.Question: What is your budget for swimming?
QApair.Answer: I can afford to pay for private lessons. Spending 500 a month on swimming is acceptable.

QApair.Question: What is your preferred swimming location?
QApair.Answer: I prefer to swim in an indoor pool. My skin is very sensitive to the water-reducing environment.

QApair.Question: What is your preferred swimming time?
QApair.Answer: I can exercise outside of school hours, such as in the early morning before going to school and in the evening and evening after school.

QApair.Question: What is your preferred swimming method?
QApair.Answer: I can swim simple freestyle and breaststroke.

QApair.Question: What is your swimming equipment?
QApair.Answer: I have a swimsuit, swimming goggles, and a swim cap. And I heard that the floating board is also helpful for the adjustment of swimming posture, so I also bought it.

QApair.Question: What is your physical condition?
QApair.Answer: My physical condition is actually not very good. My weight is about 60kg, but only 160cm. I have a little more belly fat and don't have much muscle.

QApair.Question: Is there anything else you want to tell me?
QApair.Answer: I have been diagnosed with scoliosis of the spine, so I need to do some exercise to improve my back and posture.

Instances.Output: If your goal is to use swimming for exercise to improve your health and fitness, and you have been diagnosed with scoliosis of the spine, I would recommend private lessons with a certified swimming instructor. The instructor can help you with specific exercises to improve your back and posture. You may also want to consider joining a swim team or taking group lessons at a local swim club.
